Package mgui.interfaces.trees

Class InterfaceTreePanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
mgui.interfaces.InterfacePanel
mgui.interfaces.trees.InterfaceTreePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, AttributeListener, AttributeObject, DisplayListener, InterfaceObject, CategoryObject, PopupMenuObject, NamedObject, ShapeListener, TreeListener, TreeObject, CleanableObject, IconObject
public class InterfaceTreePanel
extends InterfacePanel
implements TreeListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
Provides a tree interface for model objects
Author:
Andrew Reid

      treeUpdated in interface TreeListener

    • setCurrentState

      protected void setCurrentState()
      Sets the current state of expanded nodes. If a tree's structure is changed, the expansion state if its nodes can be restored to this state by calling restorePreviousState().

    • restorePreviousState

      protected void restorePreviousState()
      Restores the expanded state of nodes as of the last call to setCurrentState(). Calling this function will also clear the current state.
